comment._content: Eastern European POWs, probably Russians and Poles, in a labour camp. Location unknown.

comment.author: 80979187@N00
comment._content:
I can definitely tell you that they're soldiers of Soviet Army. There are no poles! 
It was dark times in our past.

comment._content:
Hartelijk dank. We zijn bezig met het verwerken van de reactie(s), ook op onze beeldbank.
Hains Hamelink, Spaarnestad Photo (partner Nationaal Archief)

comment.author: 22556303@N05
comment._content: Correction: It is known that Polish men were drafted into the Soviet Army. Please do not assume there were no Poles in that POW camp. I know of one Polish man who served for the Soviet Union. Here is a link to further verify the fact that a Polish man served in the Soviet Union military: www.southerninstitute.info/holocaust_education/henry_gall...

comment.author: 7206021@N02
comment._content: mix from Slavonic peoples, but most of them Russians

comment.author: 24155278@N00
comment._content:
my grandfather can be one on those guys on the photo.. he was POW and held in concentration camp in Estonia in 1941-1944...
in 44 he was able to run and get over front line... 

that war was much worse than on those pictures...
